title: Lax visa enforcement sparks illegal foreign businesses, unlawful activities in SL
byline: The poor enforcement of the Immigrants and Emigrants Act has led to foreign nationals from countries such as Israel, India and Russia engaging in employment activities and business operations in blatant violation of the law, the Daily Mirror learns.

title: 42 hospitalised after bus overturns in Dehiowita
byline: At least 42 people were admitted to hospital after a bus toppled this morning in the Dehiowita area along the Kegalle–Avissawella road, police said.

title: A tug of war between planes and kites in Indonesia’s skies
byline: At a paddy field two kilometres from Jakarta’s international airport, the rustle of fluttering kites is periodically drowned out by the thunderous roar of plane engines.

title: AKD’s silent, pragmatic leadership enabled SL to reduce U.S. tariffs to 20 per cent – Malik Samarawickrama
byline: Former International Trade Minister Malik Samarawickrama yesterday hailed the government for getting the U.S. reciprocal tariffs reduced to 20 per cent, enabling Sri Lankan goods to be competitive.

title: City of Dreams Sri Lanka debuts South Asia’s first integrated luxury resort
byline: City of Dreams, Sri Lanka’s largest private sector investment in luxury tourism, will open its doors today, marking the official launch of South Asia’s first fully integrated resort.

title: Law enforcers turn lawbreakers in Sri Lanka
byline: In 2025, Sri Lanka witnessed an unprecedented crackdown on police corruption, with over 300 officers suspended for various offences, including direct involvement in drug trafficking and abuse of power, a Minister said.

title: Namal welcomes US tariff cut, urges transparency on trade agreement
byline: Welcoming the reduction of the United States tariff rates on Sri Lankan exports to 20%, SLPP National Organizer Namal Rajapaksa called on the Government to ensure transparency regarding the agreements made to obtain the tariff reductions.

title: SLTB introduces platform for passenger feedback
byline: The Sri Lanka Transport Board (SLTB) has introduced a mechanism to receive passenger feedback, ideas, complaint and suggestions on public transport.

title: Sri Lanka Girl Guides key to building female leadership: PM
byline: Building female leadership is important for today’s society, and the Sri Lanka Girl Guides Association can play a big role in achieving this goal, Prime Minister Dr. Harini Amarasuriya said.

title: Hrithik Roshan arrives in Colombo
byline: Famous Indian actor Hrithik Roshan arrived at the Bandaranaike International Airport (BIA) this evening to attend the grand opening ceremony of the Cinnamon City of Dreams Hotel in Colombo.

title: Education reform a collective responsibility: PM
byline: Sri Lanka’s new education reform is not just an initiative of the Education Ministry or the leadership of President Anura Kumara Dissanayake, but a collective responsibility that must be embraced by all sectors of society to secure a better future for the country’s children, Prime Minister and Education Minister Dr. Harini Amarasuriya said.

title: Magistrate Thilina Gamage’s duties suspended
byline: The Judicial Service Commission (JSC) has suspended the judicial functions of Thilina Gamage, who served as both a Magistrate and District Judge in Moratuwa.

title: Man shot dead in Hungama over land dispute
byline: A man was shot dead this afternoon in the Pingama area of Hungama, Ambalantota, following a dispute over a paddy field, police said.
